2016-Jan-27 14:08:14 by tlmiller:
User sent us a stack dump which makes it clear that this is a problem with the world collector: 

01/27/16 10:23:43 (D_HOSTNAME) Checking if condor.cs.wisc.edu is a sinful address

/usr/lib64/libcondor_utils_8_4_3.so(_Z18linux_sig_coredumpi+0x40)[0x38be8b1930]
/lib64/libpthread.so.0[0x334e40f790]
/lib64/libc.so.6[0x334e1283fa]
/usr/lib64/libcondor_utils_8_4_3.so(_ZN11DCCollector10sendUpdateEiPN14compat_classad7ClassAdER22DCCollectorAdSequencesS2_b+0x292)[0x38be867452]

The user sees this on reconfig rather than start-up because we don't bother to update the world collector if we have no machines. We don't see this problem for any other kind of advertisement because we check to see if we're advertising a collector before we check to see if we're advertising to ourselves.

2016-Jan-28 10:18:35 by johnkn:
CODE_REVIEW: code looks ok except for use of D_FAILURE flag, which is intended for use in situations where the daemon is about to exit or fail to operate correctly. Since this is likely to be a benign failure for the common case of not being able to update the world collector. it probably should not be marked D_FAILURE.
